diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with epigastric abdominal pain radiating to the upper abdomen, associated with nausea and vomiting, and had a history of similar episodes. Imaging studies, including RUQ ultrasound and MRCP, indicated decompressed gallbladder and potential cystic changes, aligning with the final diagnosis of acute cholecystitis. No abdominal pain was reported upon admission.
